title.rendered: What Time Does the Belmont Stakes Go Off and Where Can I Watch it?

content.rendered:
The third and final installment of horse racing’s Triple Crown will occur on Saturday, June 10th at Belmont Park in Elmont, New York. The race is 1 ½ miles long and will feature some of the best 3-year-old horses in the world. This will be the 155th running of the classic race and the post time is scheduled for 7:05 PM EST as part of a full day of racing in Belmont.

What Time Will the 2023 Belmont Stakes Start?

The 2023 Belmont Stakes Post time is set for 7:05pm ET on Saturday, June 10th, 2023.

Where can I watch the Belmont Stakes Live?

If you’re not lucky enough to be able to be in New York this weekend to watch the race in person, you can still watch the event live through a variety of locations. If you live close to another race track, an off-track betting site, or casino – chances are they are offering a live simulcast experience for the event!

Belmont Stakes TV Broadcast & Streaming Schedule

This year, FOX has the rights to broadcast the Belmont Stakes event. FanDuel and Racetrack Television Network will also be streaming the race live online and via Roku/FireTV app.
